fields.description: Some characters in some languages aren't rendered properly on the diffs making it difficult to diff language files.
fields.summary: Arabic language (and possibly others) characters are rendered poorly in diffs (BB-4436)

fields.description:
The URL displayed by the web interface for a git repo (for example, https://duhrer@bitbucket.org/banga/banga.git) returns a 404 when you try to load it (although "git clone URL" does work).

If you paste that URL into the DVCS plugin for JIRA to add a new repo, the add fails.

Our instructions for the DVCS plugin don't mention anything special about bitbucket, so if this can be accomplished by other means, it should be mentioned there.
fields.summary: Can't add a GIT repo to JIRA using the DVCS plugin

fields.description: There's only the comment, no link to inbox, no link to reply, only to notifications setup.
fields.summary: notifications for inbox don't have a link (BB-4487)

fields.description:
Add an email service that delivers a shortened format between the update and the full diff. Something along the lines of the output of:

git log --name-only SHA
fields.summary: Add email service for files changed (BB-4430)

fields.description:
It doesn't seem possible ro remove the issues service.

Tried removing it from the 'Services' page, but it's still appearing.
fields.summary: Unable to remove Issues service

fields.description: Repositories need a forum/discussion feature. Creating a google group - like bitbucket-users - isn't an optimal solution, as it isn't integrated with the rest of the site.
fields.summary: Add Discussion Tab

fields.description:
Consider the attached screenshot. My name has an apostrophe in it, and rather than printing as an apostrophe in this form, it's displayed as \u0027 instead :)

Hope that helps!
fields.summary: Quotes aren't handled right in the new teams dialog

fields.description:
Please check attached file for details.

My Browser: (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_7_4) AppleWebKit/534.57.2 (KHTML, like Gecko) Version/5.1.7 Safari/534.57.2

Thanks!
fields.summary: Mouse over bug on changeset info page (BB-4439)

fields.description: I'd like to have my default "open" filter on the issues tracker sort by priority (highest to lowest). Is this possible? I think it makes more sense than the current scheme which seems to sort by time last edited. When I'm looking at issues to start working on, by definition higher priority ones are what I should be looking at first.
fields.summary: have default "open" issues filter sort by priority (BB-4432)
Wiki syntax in README (BB-4433)

fields.description:
Hi, I think that the remote mercurial URL should be editable, because if you generate the URL from the name of the project in google code this is impossible to get the correct URL, for example try with this repository:

http://code.google.com/p/chamilo/source/browse/?repo=classic

Try to import it from bitbucket and the URL you will get from bitbucket UI is:

https://chamilo.classic.googlecode.com/hg/

whilst the only one that works is:

https://code.google.com/p/chamilo.classic/

I had to use firebug to hardcode the value in the input field
fields.summary: difficulties trying to import google code repository (BB-4429)

fields.description: I would like for their to be a feature to like or favorite individual commits that appear in my Dashboard stream.
fields.summary: The ability to like or favorite commits (BB-4405)

fields.description: There should be a way in the UI to change a repository's owner from one user to another. Currently this is a manual process that must be done via a support request to support@bitbucket.org.
fields.summary: Change repository ownership (BB-4396)

fields.description:
We're seeing our Pull Request emails contains names of people we don't recognized (ie, they don't work for our company). This happens at least for "accepted" emails. In the example below, "EP Interactiv" is not a user on our account nor do they have any access to our repos.

"Pull request BCLOUD-965 has been accepted by EP Interactiv."
fields.summary: Pull request emails contain the wrong user names

fields.description: The notifications being sent from the issue tracker appear to be experiencing some issues.
fields.summary: Notifications to specific email not-working on Issue tracker (BB-4395)

fields.description:
Mail about accepted pull requests claim to be accepted by random users. Have had twice today, in both cases I accepted the request myself.

The random user doesn't even have access.

Example:

Pull request BCLOUD-56 has been accepted by barnardos.

Changes in dherzog/dragonfly-stp-1-network have been pulled into scope/dragonfly-stp-1.

https://bitbucket.org/scope/dragonfly-stp-1/pull-request/56/network-bugfixes
fields.summary: Mail about accepted pull requests mentions random users

fields.description:
Hi,\\
I'm encountering problem while cloning my repo:

remote: Counting objects: 112197, done.\\
remote: Compressing objects: 100% (83359/83359), done.\\
fatal: The remote end hung up unexpectedly23.48 MiB | 353 KiB/s\\
fatal: early EOF\\
fatal: index-pack failed

It always hangs/up at cca 23-25 MB.

Is it a kind of limitation fo free plan?
fields.summary: fatal: The remote end hung up unexpectedly

fields.description: When pushing tags only, the post-commit hook service is triggered. This may not be desired functionality.
fields.summary: Pushing tags triggers post-commit service  (BB-4390)

fields.description: Please send the diffs of a pull request in the mail notification. This would make the notfication much more useful. Thanks.
fields.summary: Send diffs in pull request notifications. (BB-4393)

fields.description: Allow users to reset their password using their username. This could send a password reset notification to all email addresses listed on the account.
fields.summary: Allow password reset by username (BB-4389)

fields.description:
Hello,

Even users who do have rights to write in a repository, even when they commit with their exact BitBucket name, it's not recognized and must be aliased as well.

Thank you.
fields.summary: Unrecognized usernames

fields.description:
We have a lot of small repositories (40+) that we occasionally get pull requests for. Since we rarely have time to accept or decline them immediately, we often forget them.

It would be extremely cool to have an overview in our account homepage (maybe somewhere on https://bitbucket.org/repo/mine) that shows _all_ pull requests our account has received. This would make it much easier for us to manage the repositories.
fields.summary: Account-wide overview for PRs and Issues (BB-4392)

fields.description:
Hi all,\\
I want to suggest adding x10 Syntax highlighting to bitbucket.\\
http://x10-lang.org/

If it helps:\\
There are already syntax files for x10 out there, i'm not sure though how bitbucket handles it.

For Gtkview:\\
http://cs.anu.edu.au/~Josh.Milthorpe/x10-21.lang

For vim:\\
http://x10.svn.sourceforge.net/viewvc/x10/trunk/x10.common/contrib/vim/

Cheers mates
fields.summary: x10 Syntax highlighting

fields.description: I pasted my git url from unfuddle but it says there is no repo at that location. I would really like to use the importer rather than pushing from my laptop as it would be a lot faster.
fields.summary: Cannot import git repo from Unfuddle

fields.description: Look my attachment, this happens in chrome:
fields.summary: The "Find issues" text in the search text field next to Build query button can't bee seen entirely

fields.description:
After making a typo when creating an issue, I try to correct it. The title looks editable, when I click on it it goes into edit mode, but it doesn't save, or its not obvious how to save

It should save when the editing textbox looses focus.
fields.summary: I Cant edit the title of an issue

fields.description:
The text fields for search commit at the changesets page looks broken.\\
Same for the "Find issue" field here: https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issues/new

Browser information: Google Chrome under Linux.

Screenshots attached.
fields.summary: Fix search fields height

fields.description:
every time I run a search from the code tab it gives a 404 error.

the search box is also has a vertical height issue that cuts off the input field from being readable.
fields.summary: code search 404

fields.description: The browse at revision "search" box shouldn't appear as if it was a regular search box. This can lead to confusion as the box is designed to allow a user to input a specific revision only and quick-browse to that revision.
fields.summary: Browse at revision box shouldn't appear as a search box (BB-4344)

fields.description:
It seems that tags now replay the payload of the previous commit. There is no way to distinguish tags from commits.

Did something break on bitbucket recently that could cause this change ?
fields.summary: POST webhook behavior changed (BB-4394)

fields.description: I'm using Google Chrome 18.0.1025.151 (Developer Build 130497 Linux) Ubuntu 11.10. It's not happen on FF 11 with same OS
fields.summary: Search Bar didn't Rendered Correctly

fields.description: It would be very useful if I could write a script (e.g. in Python) which would create tickets automatically. E.g. I would like to automatically create a ticket for every feedback that comes to the feedback form on my site. Of course, certain limits should be posed to avoid spam, but basically this feature would be very useful.
fields.summary: Automatic ticket creation

fields.description:
Hi there. We just completed a pull request/approve and the notification email shows the wrong user details - thought you'd want to know!

I've attached screenshots.
fields.summary: Pull request notification shows wrong user details (BB-4341)

fields.description: The listing of a user's repositories don't appear to be in any order on /repo/mine.
fields.summary: Repositories on /repo/mine aren't listed in any order (BB-4340)

fields.description:
It might be just me and my 12.4 ubuntu + chromium setup, but the search text box in the issues page next to the 'build query' button becomes unreadable when you are typing into it. The text it hidden below the visible area.

Attached is the screenshot
fields.summary: Search bar too small (BB-4338)

fields.description:
When I go into admin settings/repository details and change 'landing page' to 'issues', the overview tab becomes inaccessible, and will forward you to issues.

When I return the 'landing page' setting to overview. it works again.

Idd like to have issues as the default page, and still be able to access the overview
fields.summary: Overview tab breaks (BB-4337)

In fact, no XAML(Microsoft .NET WPF) files are highlighted in source view, atleast not for me on Win7/FF12.\\
Highlighting should not differ from plain XML very much (except the missing <?xml - tag).

fields.description: Prompting for password while adding ssh key will reduce the security risk.
fields.summary: Prompt for password while adding ssh key (BB-4335)

fields.description:
Hi,

After pushing a bookmark to a bitbucket repository (or after updating a bookmark) it doesn't gets updated in 'changes' page. It seems developer have to click on a bookmark to get it updated but I'm not sure.
fields.summary: Bookmarks updates are not instant (BB-4387)

fields.description:
The following changeset shows an incorrect diff in Bitbucket:

https://bitbucket.org/harsman/dyalog-mode/changeset/8c67f0756826

One of the context lines is incorrectly marked green, and one of the added lines is missing completely.

In the actual Mercurial repository everything is ok. Here's the actual diff:

=== (+3,-1) dyalog-mode.el ===\\
@@ -319,6 +319,8 @@\\
(set (make-local-variable 'comment-use-global-state) t)\\
(set (make-local-variable 'comment-use-syntax) t)\\
(set (make-local-variable 'font-lock-defaults) '(dyalog-font-lock-keywords))

* ;; Dyalog always indents with spaces
* (set (make-local-variable 'indent-tabs-mode) nil)\\
;; below line doesn't seem to help, same results as with standard\\
;; ediff-forward-word. If same line is in .emacs it works, so setting\\
;; here is probably too late (or early?).
fields.summary: Incorrect diff (BB-4339)

fields.description: The merge was applied correctly, but the webpage still showing the loading animation. Screenshot attached
fields.summary: Error when merge dev with master (BB-4347)

fields.description: Please add an issue type for 'test'
fields.summary: Add issue type 'test' (BB-4321)

fields.description: I'm pretty sure this used to work. It's really painful to create new wiki pages now, especially if the titles are more than one word.
fields.summary: Creating a link to a new wiki page just links to a 404 instead of letting you edit the new page

fields.description:
On line 4 of the clone your new repo instructions. The command is listed as follows:

git remote add origin https://staging.bitbucket.org/USER_NAME/bacon.git

This should read:

git remote add origin https://USER_NAME@staging.bitbucket.org/USER_NAME/bacon.git

If you add a remote origin and push without the username, you are prompted for a username anyway. There is not a clear reason to exclude it.
fields.summary: "Clone your new repo" instructions are incorrect for a public repo (BB-4311)

fields.description:
I have a repo which contains exports from Cuis 4.0 in .pck format, which is essentially the Squeak file-out format. I'd appreciate it if I could get syntax highlighting. Just a would-be-nice-someday kind of thing.

Assuming you can see private repos, fusiongyro/Cuis is one with this content in it. You can also see what this might look like on Github here:

https://github.com/jvuletich/Cuis/blob/master/CuisUpdates/1261-CuisCore-JuanVuletich-2012Apr25-09h17m-jmv.9.cs

Looks a little weird there, to be honest, the string quoting seems to be messed up.

Thanks for your time!
fields.summary: Smalltalk syntax highlighting (BB-4345)

fields.description:
Currently the email service for commits and diffs only supports 1 email address. We need more.

http://confluence.atlassian.com/download/attachments/223216621/image2011-9-19+15%3A48%3A17.png?version=1&modificationDate=1316411297764
fields.summary: As a user I would like to have the option to send to multiple email recipients the commits on my repository

fields.description:
Hi,

at GitHub I'm able to close / resolve an issue using a comment like\\
"resolves BCLOUD-7" on a commit.\\
Pushing the commit to GitHub, issue BCLOUD-7 is automatically set to resolved. The commit's comment is appended to issue BCLOUD-7; together with a link to the commit.\\
Can this feature be added to BitBucket? Or am I just not finding the documentation on it?
fields.summary: Close / Resolve issues using comment of a commit

fields.description:
I'm trying to add a "Link" to my JIRA server.\\
I'm pretty sure I entered the server URL and the key properly. Yet, I always get the following error message in red when I click the button:

More information is available with DEBUG=True.
fields.summary: Cannot add a new Repository Link

fields.description:
I'm hitting the 1.0 API URLs like I have been for the past six months, but all of a sudden the main_branch key in the repository json object disappeared.

For example https://api.bitbucket.org/1.0/repositories/tortoisehg/thg/branches/ has 3. Now you could guess that "default" is the default, but not all projects follow that, such as https://api.bitbucket.org/1.0/repositories/wbond/flourish/branches/.

Any chance you can restore that key to 1.0 and delete it from version 1.1 of the API?
fields.summary: main_branch json key disappeared

fields.description:
From my end it looks like the bitbucket.org https cert fingerprint changed recently. Is that so?

Was: 81:2b:08:90:dc:d3:71:ee:e0:7c:b4:75:ce:9b:6c:48:94:56:a1:fe

Is: 24:9c:45:8b:9c:aa:ba:55:4e:01:6d:58:ff:e4:28:7d:2a:14:ae:3b
fields.summary: fingerprint change

fields.description:
When you write an issue you may not remember the nickname of all you teammates.

Let's assume the your teammate nickname is "TeamMate"\\
Il would be great if in the preview, when you write down @teamMate, would appear as a link only if user teamMate exist on bitbucket.

In this case, assuming no user has the nick teamMate, i should see in the preview no clickable link.

It would be greater if you made it a link only if this is really a guy who works with you in the repo you are posting the issue.

But i will be happy anyway with the first solution.

Sorry for my poor english.
fields.summary: Modify issuetracker preview bheaviour (BB-4308)

fields.description:
When commenting on an existing ticket, there are two buttons: "Update issue" and "Bump!".

However, it's not very clear what the difference is between those two. I found [[http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Using+your+bitbucket+Issue+Tracker|this help page]] but it wasn't very helpful.

I'm guessing that "Bump!" is like "Update issue" just without the need to actually enter a comment, right? If so, perhaps the "Update issue" button should read "Bump!" as long as the user hasn't changed any details nor typed a comment.

Otherwise the difference should be documented somewhere (maybe in a tooltip).
fields.summary: Document difference between "Update Issue" and "Bump!" (BB-4307)

fields.description:
on a new issues page ({{{/issues/new}}}), \

the {{{#preview}}} window below the textarea shows links containing paths to {{{/issues}}} instead of {{{/wiki}}}, when added by ~[[page]] markup.

For instance, if i make a link to the [[Welcome]] wiki page, \\\
as of writing it generates a link to https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issues/Welcome instead of {{{/wiki/Welcome}}} path.

However, it behaves correctly -- links to {{{/wiki/Welcome}}} -- once I save the content and see the result. I was very confused the first time when writing the Issue, because I wasn't sure it would link to the wiki (as I intended) or to the issue. Maybe I wasn't the only one who was confused..? :)

Other than that, I highly recommend the preview window. I think we should have more of them, everywhere. The current preview button is too slow for a quick check up.
fields.summary: Wrong link on preview window of new issues page

fields.description: https://bitbucket.org/durin42/hgsubversion/overview used to render my ReST-format README, and it's not anymore.
fields.summary: README files no longer rendering

fields.description:
Please, delete these repositories

https://bitbucket.org/user_name/repo

because I get this message

"Oops! An error occurred"

when I wish to enter to them :(

Thanks!
fields.summary: Oops! An error occurred

fields.description:
Hi there,

I created a new repository using git, tried cloning the wiki, didn't work.

{{{\\
dsktp% git clone git@bitbucket.org:sentimental/netlink_experiments.git\\
Cloning into 'netlink_experiments'...\\
warning: You appear to have cloned an empty repository.

dsktp% git clone git@bitbucket.org:sentimental/netlink_experiments.git/wiki netlink_experiments_wiki\\
Cloning into 'netlink_experiments_wiki'...\\
fatal: The remote end hung up unexpectedly\\
}}}

Deleted the repository.

Created a new repository, this time using Mercurial.

Cloned the repository, fine, no problem.

Tried to clone the wiki (this had always worked before)

{{{\\
hg clone ssh://hg@bitbucket.org/sentimental/netlink_experiments/wiki\\
running ssh hg@bitbucket.org "hg -R sentimental/netlink_experiments/wiki serve --stdio"\\
abort: no suitable response from remote hg!\\
}}}

Is there something wrong on the back-end or am I being incredibly obtuse?

Thanks,

Bryan Hunt
fields.summary: cant clone wiki

fields.description:
I'd like to see code statistics on my project overview pages, à la ohloh.net. For this, I'm guessing you could integrate ohcount? I just don't feel like creating an ohloh account for this. Also, even if I were to create one, I wouldn't be able to use it with my private repositories.

http://www.ohloh.net/p/ohcount\\
https://github.com/blackducksw/ohcount

Please? :)
fields.summary: Show code stats on overview pages (BB-4298)

fields.description: Please consider making a "My open issues" button on the issue tracker. Currently there are: All, Open, My Issues. I would use, "My Open Issues" most of all but have to create a custom query each time.
fields.summary: "My open issues" (BB-4297)

fields.description:
As a bit bucket user when I view commits it shows all the commit dates as X Days ago. For usability, when the commit is more than a week old it would be more beneficial displaying a full date. So that I can quickly locate the commits on a specific date rather than calculating (current date - X days ago)

:)
fields.summary: Commits - Date (Changesets date)

fields.description:
I have a (mercurial) repository which is public, but for which only I have write access.  In this project, I also have a wiki and this is configured such that it can be edited by anyone.

Editing works: one of my users has gone to the wiki, clicked 'edit' and made changes to the page.  However, although he can "hg clone" the wiki, he can't "hg push" to it.  Given that he can edit it online, it seems a bit ridiculous that he can't edit it offline, especially since this is one of the main 'selling' points of the bitbucket wiki!
fields.summary: Can't push to publicly editable wiki

fields.description:
Hi.. The first link redirects to the login page. The second one does not redirect. It just times out. After login on by using the first link the second works as it is supposed to.

So. Unauthorized request on the second link does not redirect to the loginform.

https://bitbucket.org/{user}/{repo}\\
https://bitbucket.org/{user}/{repo}/changesets
fields.summary: Missing redirect on unauthorized get request
Clone wiki repos with Git using SSH - not working

fields.description:
It seems to that the default behavior of automatically attaching each and every group to a newly created private repository is wrong.

Here's my use-case:\\
I have several projects that I've created.  There exists a "developers" group and they automatically are given "write" permission (from the group) - I'm fine with that, however, now I'm bringing in a consultant to work on vary specific project - I create a "Consultants" group and add the consultant to that group.  I now create a repository for his project - ok great, both the consultant group and developers group have write access.  Now I create a new internal private repo for my developers - uh oh, the consultant is now given default access to the new repo - I understand that i can go into each repo and remove the consultant group (I really don't want them to have even read access to some projects).

I think it would be better to either have a "new repo creation" default list of groups that are automatically attached and/or force the repo creator to select which groups should have permissions to the repo when it is created so they made explicitly aware of who can have what access, if any to any repo.
fields.summary: Default Group Access on New Repository Creation

fields.description: Hey. Are you guys planning on posting some info about what features you're working on? There are lots of proposals on the issue list, you often mention a backlog and we're very curious what we can expect in the next weeks/months. Can you give us a glimpse on what's rolling, post on the blog (or somewhere else) from time to time?
fields.summary: bitbucket roadmap

fields.description:
You can find out what private repositories exist by brute-forcing the urls while not being logged in.

If a private repository exists you are redirectet to a login-page, e.g.:

https://bitbucket.org/account/signin/?next=/conro/test

If a private repository does not exist, you get a 404, eg:

https://bitbucket.org/conro/doesNorExist

This is a problem if the public should not know about the existance of private repository, e.g: /apple/ios7 or /valve/hl3
fields.summary: Private repositories tell you about their existance

fields.description: When I review Milestones I have set for a repository I see the list of them and beside each appears a little pencil. The little pencil has a tooltip 'Click to Edit' but when I click nothing happens.
fields.summary: Cannot edit Milestone description ? (BB-4299)

fields.summary: TortoiseHg Bug Report

fields.description:
When viewing large pull requests, after a certain point the file diffs are collapsed, and have a 'Click to load' link. These links do not always load, giving instead a js error of 'head is not defined' at line 1098 of https://dwz7u9t8u8usb.cloudfront.net/m/c4ab365c4bdd/bun/js/bundle.js

The files that fail to load seem to be consistent (but there isn't anything special about the diffs that I can identify), and this happens across browsers (tested in firefox and chrome).

Edit: This is for git repositories
fields.summary: Pull requests not loading all diffs (BB-4272)

fields.description: Add a way to show an announcement banner of some kind over the issues pages. This way, if a user wants to tell their followers information about creating issues (rules etc.) that have a clear way to communicate that when the source and wiki are private.
fields.summary: Add an Issues announcement banner (BB-4244)

fields.description:
I have a main repo that is only private and I have some peoples with a fork of this repo.

When someone create a fork of my private main repo I should have admin access that is not deletable to there fork repo. This way if I want to delete the fork or control what is done by this fork I can manage it.

I have an employe with 2 forks from my main repo and this employee is not working for me anymore. So I would like to delete theses 2 repo but I don't have access.

Thank you
fields.summary: Admin access to the fork repo (BB-4257)

fields.description:
When accessing a URL to a file directly outside of a web browser, basic authentication isn't being requested and access is denied.

example:\\
curl https://user_name@bitbucket.org/user_name/repository/get/master.zip
fields.summary: Basic auth not working for direct file downloads, including zip (BB-4243)

fields.description: External (non-bitbucket) git submodules won't show up if they're not at the root level.
fields.summary: External git submodules don't show up  (BB-3270)
Unable to fetch from remote repo

fields.description: As simple as the title suggests. browsing a file history that change the name somewhere on the past, stops the history there. If the --follow parameters is used to generate the entries, it should be possible to show *all* the file history.
fields.summary: Use git log --follow when watching the changes made on a file (BB-4247)

fields.description: There should be a way to search for issues by the issue number. ie. "#120" should bring a list with issue BCLOUD-120 included.
fields.summary: Search for issues by issue number (BB-4240)

fields.description:
I created the following repositores by importing them from SVN, and I'm getting the following error on all of them.  Another repository which we use (https://bitbucket.org/jblaya/odk-voice-joaquinblaya) is working fine.

abort: HTTP Error 500: INTERNAL SERVER ERROR. Command line: /home/jblaya/Dropbox/workspace:hg -y clone --noupdate https://***@bitbucket.org/jblaya/callscheduler callscheduler, error code: 255

The repositories are\\
https://bitbucket.org/jblaya/tags\\
https://bitbucket.org/jblaya/openmrs-1.6.x\\
https://bitbucket.org/jblaya/programmablealerts\\
https://bitbucket.org/jblaya/callscheduler\\
https://bitbucket.org/jblaya/chileregistration\\
https://bitbucket.org/jblaya/voicecaller\\
https://bitbucket.org/jblaya/visitscheduler\\
https://bitbucket.org/jblaya/smsmodule\\
https://bitbucket.org/jblaya/jslibs
fields.summary: Created several repositories from SVN and get Error 500 Internal Server Error

fields.description:
Hello,

When attempting to push to the clarksmr/civitas repository I receive the above indicated error. In searching for help with this I stumbled across an old topic with new posts that suggested all such issues should be directed towards support through a ticket.

Thank you,

Chris
fields.summary: HTTP Error 550 Internal Server Error

fields.description:
The REST API allows a repository to be queried for a list of branches. What is returned by the API is a JSON litteral, not a list of branches.

{\\
"master": { ... },\\
"trunk": { ... }\\
}

It should be formed something like {[ { "name" : "master", ... }, { "name" : "trunk", ... } ]}

It would also be useful if it could also return if the branch is currently involved in a pull-request.
fields.summary: REST API - List of branches is not a JSON List (BB-4242)

fields.description: in ko medule some times error / acsess denied is coming..basically its coming on that mooment whenever you click..............
fields.summary: error/acsess denied

fields.description:
Hi,

With "141a2d1d8dbd | bitbucket01" when I try to open an unknown wiki page I get a 404 error instead of an opportunity to create a new page.

It seems that the only way to create a new page now is to clone the repository and create the page locally.

Best regards,
fields.summary: Create new wiki page when following link to unknown/non-existant page (BB-4238)

fields.description: I sent a message to someone and wanted to send a followup after I discovered something related. So I hit reply, and sent that off. Here's where the UI gets confusing. The reply says it is from me and to me. Either the UI is misrepresenting the message (and it did go to the other person) or it is telling me the truth and that it actually did the wrong thing. Did it go to the other person or just to me? If the latter, can this be fixed, please? Thanks.
fields.summary: User-to-user messages behave strangely (BB-4236)

fields.description:
We use BitBucket together with JIRA OnDemand, and when we set up a repository tied to a project in JIRA we always name the repository the same as the JIRA //project key//.

We imported some of our old subversion repositories, and realized after it was too late that the repositories had been named in all-lowercase letters. We tried to fix this by changing the name of the repository to all-caps, but the change does not go through. I guess this is because the name is case insensitive.

It seems possible to work around this issue by renaming in two steps.
fields.summary: Repository naming, changing case (BB-4235)

fields.description: The link has a '|' character in it and the hash is doubled.
fields.summary: Commit emails show the commit link with a doubled hash (BB-4215)

fields.description:
I've tried to set up a service for my repository\\
*radical* / *mean-machines* to connect to my Jenkins installation via\\
both Jenkins and POST integration. I've failed dramatically, without any\\
debug or error information.

<<some of the private info removed>>

And got nothing. For both I see no hit from any outside world to my Apache proxy, and removing/adding the service brings no results as well. Last time I've checked I got some POST service response withing 10 seconds after doing //git push//, but no action at all on Jenkins.
fields.summary: Unicode error with Jenkins service (BB-4199)

fields.description: I downloaded Adblock Lite on May 11, 2012.  It not only blocked adds at the weather channel site but it keeps the weather channel videos from playing.  I immediately removed it and the adds are back but the videos are still broken even after reboot.   Please help.
fields.summary: Adblock Lite Blocks Weather Channel Videos

fields.description:
Bitbucket has a help doc on code review: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Setting+Up+the+Bitbucket+Rietveld+Service

A few issues with this:

# User comments seem to indicate integration with bitbucket is cumbersome (haven't tried it myself)
# Rietveld doesn't seem to be actively maintained and more importantly Gerrit which has more recent activity shares its origins with rietveld. From the little research I've done online looks like improved version of rietveld.

So just making a suggestion here that it'd be great if bitbucket would integrate gerrit as a service: http://code.google.com/p/gerrit/

I had signed up for an asembla account but later switched to bitbucket due to unlimited repositories for the free account. However assembla has gerrit integration and looks pretty cool: http://blog.assembla.com/assemblablog/tabid/12618/bid/40871/Introducing-Gerrit-a-scalable-code-review-system.aspx

Would be great if bitbucket could add this as well, believe it would be a better addon service than current code review feature.

Thnx.
fields.summary: Code Review -- Gerrit (BB-4197)

fields.description:
When I visit: https://bitbucket.org/birkenfeld/pygments-main/src/7925d53cb09d/pygments/lexers/web.py\\
,I don't get syntax highlighting.
fields.summary: Syntax Highlighting bug

fields.description:
I have a bunch of projects using Git and everytime I push changes to the wiki repo, I am prompted for my user's password, and this is a hassle.

It would be nice if a URI for cloning wiki repositories through SSH was provided, so that the account's SSH keys become usable.
fields.summary: Clone wiki repos with Git using SSH (BB-4283)

fields.description: e.g., https://bitbucket.org/talklittle/follow
fields.summary: Repository named "follow" has URL collision with user follow link (BB-4198)

fields.description:
This is all I see in Eclipse (egit):

Exception caught during execution of fetch command.

The following command just hangs:

git clone https://tuningbell@bitbucket.org/tuningbell/isokeys.git

This has worked in the past, and cloning from Sourceforge still works. So I think there is a problem on your end.

Thanks, Dave
fields.summary: Cannot clone isokeys.git

fields.description:
Hi,

When i run:

{{{\\
hg clone ssh://hg@bitbucket.org/lakin.wecker/freeandeasytraveler.com fne\\
}}}

I get:\\
{{{\\
remote: Permission denied (publickey).\\
abort: no suitable response from remote hg!\\
}}}

This worked two days ago without issue.

Since then i've upgraded from ubuntu 10.04 to xubuntu 12.04

I have created new sshe keys and the error persists. Any suggestions would be welcome.

M.
fields.summary: Permission denied (publickey).

fields.description: I want to link my bitbucket projects to careers.stackoverflow.com but they ask for write access. There's a question on meta about it and they say that the bitbucket api has an all or nothing model. Please give them a way to request read-only access.
fields.summary: Please allow read only access via the api

fields.description: Could you please add the M language to the list of select-able languages?
fields.summary: Request for language addition

fields.description:
Browsing a previous version of a file requires clicking the home tab, entering the relevant revision in a free text box, then navigating to the desired file.

A much more user-friendly and intuitive workflow would be to simply include a browse link with each item in the file's history.
fields.summary: Browse link for file history
